conclusion: Analyze contributions from charges at points 2q and -q to determine electric field at point A.
Cube has side length L; charges 2q and -q are at opposite vertices; midpoint O is on the body diagonal.
Distance between charges 2q and -q is the body diagonal of the cube: L√3.
Electric field E at distance r from charge q is given by Coulomb's law: E = ke|q|/r^2.
Electric field at midpoint O due to 2q: ke(2q)/(3L^2).
Electric field at midpoint O due to -q: ke(q)/(3L^2).
Net electric field at O: ke(q)/(3L^2).
Distance from each charge to point A is the face diagonal: L√2.
Electric field at point A due to 2q: ke(q)/(L^2).
Electric field at point A due to -q: ke(q)/(2L^2).
Net electric field at A: ke(q)/(2L^2).
Magnitude of electric field at point A is E_A = ke(q)/(2L^2).
Magnitude of electric field at point A is 2E/3.
